page.title: 01BROOMFIELD IN THE QUANTOCKS
page.content: Broomfield is a small village in the Quantock Hills six miles from Taunton.It is in an area of great natural beauty and is often visited by tourists. Much of the area between Broomfield and Enmore is wooded. Broomfield Church and Fyne Court are of historical interest and the latter is the administrative centre of the Somerset Trust for Nature Conservation. The Forestry Commission has large areas of woodland, including Wind Down where there is an Iron Age hill fort called Ruborough Camp. Enmore School is two miles from Broomfield and in 1985 it celebrated its 175th Anniversary. At one time there were small copper mines in the Broomfield area..
